src: ma  xos  stori  navan    xos  bus      ig-e\footnotemark{}
trs: So maybe my story ends there.
They slept here.
They found this place.
They went to prison in that place, Lamap.
this woman
these two
this big shellfish
these two boys of theirs
these different things
this boy of his
this crab hole
this volcano that’s burning up there
the ones from Maat
this little girl and her mum
The snake also went to them.
I wasn’t here.
this volcano crater
She took this crab.

src: ueili  {\ob}xa  tati  ba  te-pou-e    e  Saot-Is{\cb}   xiak
trs: the pig that Dad went and got from the Southeast
the yard that we put the church in
It’s not our place here.
Nephew is here.
Are you coming now?
The sun is setting now.

src: kavmen    mi-leh      moletin   xil tu     la-mmei     Epi   xiak
trs: The government had already brought people to Epi then.
This one wants to learn our language.
I started my business with this.
They covered the laplap\footnote{Laplap is a food made from grated root vegetables or banana soaked in coconut milk and baked in leaves.} with that.
They disrespected me.
that old woman
those fish
that white reef
those things of theirs

src: ma-be         {\ob}{\ob}rute   {\ob}xa   xouk       o-bit       mal-naa-va =ti en{\cb}{\cb} xi-e{\cb}
trs: We went to that place that you told us not to go to.
that snake
It [the earthquake] shook a lot then.
Its tail was in there.
It was as much as I could buy with the money that I got. I started my business with this.
They had two boys. They had these two boys of theirs, they looked after them.
that little house up there
this aunt of yours
They saw um, this house.
[You must go hunt on this side (\textit{ak}) because of] our home there.

src: avu    xa  xi-e    mei      pol-ni      travol
trs: That ancestor came and made trouble.
It [World War Two] started in 1942 then.

src: ut   mi-ttin     ma  na-po        rat-i    xie
trs: It’s hot so I’ll take it out now.

src: ale  lanstaem  turei    xie,  va      ra-vanien
trs: Okay, it’s lunchtime already now, let’s go eat.

src: meu     na-pein-ni     xouk   turei       bus       xie
trs: Megapode I’ve already finished painting you now.
They weren’t pastors yet then.
[They took out] um that thing’s egg.
Like this, then, just like this.
It’s like this so I called you.’ (i.e. ‘That’s why I called you.’)
(A:) ‘We’ll just burn the garden.’ – (B:) ‘Oh good, that’s the way.

src: xir,  evri  Sade    ra-ga      laplap  mak
trs: Us, every Sunday we eat laplap like this.
They roll it like this.

src: tati  natel    gur      huit  tavu    tei  mak
trs: Their Dad took a bushnut like this.

src: mi-sak    pis-i    va-leh      rat  asu  va-mak
trs: [He pulled and pulled and pulled…] he tried to take out the rat like this.
Young people, sometimes we stay like this.

src: a-naa-pis     siboro   =ti       naa-maxai         e   u-pis       siboro   i-xoni       ngan =ak
trs: You don’t roll simboro like that, you roll it like this one.
He um, he cried a lot.
We’ll um, we’ll work.
We um, we eat it.
They um what, they burnt it.
The rat um what, took the fire stick.
